sen.j: 表衣（おもてぎぬ）は十二単を構成する着物の一つ。
sen.e: Omoteginu is one kimono of many kimonos forming juni-hitoe (a dress style of noble females of medieval times).
Omoteginu is one of many kimonos forming juni-hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono).
sen.cmt: シンプル化＋用語共有を反映
sen.e: Omoteginu is one of many kimonos forming juni-hitoe (twelve-layered ceremonial kimono).

sen.j: 単衣→五衣（五枚の袿）→打衣の上に着用する。
sen.e: The order of wearing kimonos of juni-hitoe is, first, one hitoe (kimono without lining), next, five uchikakes (formal kimonos), next, one uchiginu (kimono for adjusting the whole shape of juni-hitoe), and last, one omoteginu.

It is worn in the follwoing order; first, one hitoe (a single layer of kimono), next, five uchigi (ordinary kimono), next, one uchiginu (a beaten scarlet silk robe worn as a stiffener and support for the outer robes), and last, one omoteginu.

It is put on in the following order: first, one hitoe (a single layer of a kimono) is put on; next, five uchigi (ordinary kimono) are put on; next, one uchiginu (a beaten scarlet silk robe worn as a stiffener and support for the outer robes) is put on; and finally, one omoteginu is put on.

sen.j: 形は単や袿と変わらないが、一番外側に羽織る着物で目に留まるため、他の着物と違い、二陪織物（ふたべおりもの）などの豪華な生地から調製するのが特徴である。
sen.e: The shape of omoteginu isn't different from hitoe or uchikake, however, since it is worn last covering the other kimonos of juni-hitoe, it is usually made of luxurious materials such as futabe-orimono (cloth drawn base pattern and front pattern on its base pattern).

The shape of omoteginu isn't different from hitoe or uchigi, however, since it is worn last covering the other kimonos of juni-hitoe, it is usually made of luxurious materials such as futabe-orimono (silk double weave).

The shape of the omoteginu is no different to that of the hitoe or uchigi; however, since it is the outermost kimono that covers the other kimonos of the juni-hitoe, it is usually made of luxurious materials such as futabe-orimono (silk double weave).
